entry.title: GraphLint: Creating a Domain Specific Language for Graph Validation
entry.content: This is a bit late, but I had written a blog post for the project I worked on during my winter internship at Knewton. My article was published on their tech blog here. I created a domain specific language to verify certain predicates on directed property graphs (e.g. all nodes of type A are connected to exactly 2 nodes of type B via edges of type E). This was a great exercise in the material I learned from the compilers course I took in the fall. Designing the language, the validation engine, and engineering the whole project was an awesome experience!
